```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(data.table)
```

```{r, show_col_types = FALSE}
# Load the datasets
genes_data <- read_csv('QBS103_GSE157103_genes.csv', show_col_types = FALSE)
metadata <- read_csv('QBS103_GSE157103_series_matrix.csv', show_col_types = FALSE)
# Rename the column `...1` to `Genes`
genes_data <- genes_data %>% rename(Genes = `...1`)
```

```{r}
# Select the first gene
gene <- genes_data[1, ]
gene_name <- as.character(gene[1,1])
transposed_gene <- transpose(gene[-1]) %>% rename(!!gene_name := V1)
print(transposed_gene)
transposed_gene_data <- cbind(participant_id = colnames(gene[-1]), transposed_gene)
print(transposed_gene_data)
merged_data <- merge(metadata, transposed_gene_data, by = "participant_id")
print(merged_data)
```



```{r}
continuous_covariate <- "age" 
categorical_covariate1 <- "sex" 
categorical_covariate2 <- "disease_status" 
```

```{r}
### Plots ###
# Histogram for gene expression
gene_histogram <- ggplot(merged_data, aes_string(x = gene_name)) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(y = ..density..), binwidth = 0.05, color = "black", fill = "#1dddeb", alpha = 0.7) + 
  geom_density(aes(y = ..density..), color = "white", size = 1) +
  labs(x = gene_name, y = "Density") +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = '#333333', color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = '#333333', color = NA),
    text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", color = 'white', size = 20),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 14),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 12, color = 'white'),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "white"),
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, hjust = 0.5, color = 'white'),
  ) +
  ggtitle("Histogram of Gene Expression")

# Save the histogram
ggsave("gene_histogram.png", plot = gene_histogram, width = 16, height = 9)

# Print the histogram
print(gene_histogram)
```

```{r}
# Scatter plot
merged_data$age <- as.numeric(merged_data$age)

# Plot
scatter_plot <- ggplot(merged_data, aes_string(x = "age", y = gene_name)) + 
  geom_point(color = "#F8B195", size = 2) + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", color = "#95ebf8") +  # Add a LOESS curve
  geom_rug(color = "white") +  # Add a rug plot
  labs(x = "Age", y = gene_name) +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = '#333333', color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = '#333333', color = NA),
    text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", color = 'white', size = 20),
    axis.title = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 14, color = 'white'),
    axis.text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 12, color = 'white'),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "white"),
    plot.title = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 16, hjust = 0.5, color = 'white'),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "gray70", size = 0.1),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(color = "gray70", size = 0.1)
  ) 
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot of Gene Expression vs Age")

# Save the scatter plot
ggsave("scatter_plot.png", plot = scatter_plot, width = 16, height = 9)

# Print the scatter plot
print(scatter_plot)
```

```{r}
# Box Plot
merged_data <- merged_data %>% filter(sex != "unknown")
# Define a color palette and labels for the legend
palette <- c("disease state: COVID-19" = "#66c2a5", "disease state: non-COVID-19" = "#fc8d62")
labels <- c("disease state: COVID-19" = "COVID-19", "disease state: non-COVID-19" = "non-COVID-19")

# Plot
boxplot <- ggplot(merged_data, aes_string(x = categorical_covariate1, y = gene_name, fill = categorical_covariate2)) + 
  geom_boxplot(outlier.color = "red", outlier.size = 2, color = "white") + 
  labs(x = "Sex", y = "Gene Expression", fill = "Disease Status") +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = '#2E2E2E', color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = '#2E2E2E', color = NA),
    text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", color = 'white', size = 16),
    axis.title = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 18, color = 'white'),
    axis.text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 14, color = 'white'),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "white"),
    plot.title = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 20, color = 'white'),
    legend.position = 'top',
    legend.background = element_rect(fill = "#2E2E2E", color = NA),
    legend.text = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", color = 'white', size = 14),
    legend.title = element_text(family = "Times New Roman", color = 'white', size = 14),
    legend.key = element_rect(fill = "#2E2E2E", color = NA),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "gray50", size = 0.5)
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette, labels = labels) + 
  ggtitle("Boxplot of Gene Expression by Sex and Disease Status")

# Save the boxplot
ggsave("boxplot.png", plot = boxplot, width = 16, height = 9)

# Print the boxplot
print(boxplot)
```
